fields.description:
I created a review for somebody else's code.  Naturally it made me the moderator.
Subsequently, having already made some review comments, I tried to change the author to the moderator and make myself a reviewer.
This failed with no error.  
I tried a few times.
Eventually I did it one step at a time:
* changed the moderator
* hit Done
* added myself as an author
* hit Done

That worked fine.

In case there was an error logged on the server, the review is https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-CONF-384
fields.summary: Changing moderator and adding a reviewer simultaneously in "Edit Review" fails silently.

fields.description:
Its possible to change the project key format in JIRA so it is not in the form {{[A-Z][A-Z]+}}.

When linking issues crucible first validates the issue key passed conforms to {{^[A-Z]{2,}-\d+$}} which doesn't work if you use alpha numeric project keys. 

We should either skip the validation altogether or provide an a way to change the format regex so it can work with customised JIRA project keys.
fields.summary: Linking to JIRA issues doesn't work when you customise the JIRA issue key format

fields.description: When all reviewers have completed their review, the moderator organizes a meeting where we discuss the comments. During this meeting we decide, which comment has to be fixed. We'd like, that the moderator can mark the comments respectively. (Currently the only possibility is, to write all of this as text into the summary. You can imagine that this is very cumbersome when you have more than 10 comments)
fields.summary: An moderator should be able to mark comments as "to be fixed"

fields.description: See https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2426
fields.summary: Fix links in suggestions tab

fields.description:
With the removal of the fixed content area an alternate placement needs to be found for warning messages that currently appear there.

!http://img.skitch.com/20090925-k8a75ja3rfxdaafafduiktf9kr.jpg!
fields.summary: Warnings are displayed in the soon to be defunct fixed area

fields.description:
Related to support issue  https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CRC-501

The efficiency of the author blame calculation is bad in some situations, particularly on incremental updates to files that have been edited many times.  There's a couple of things that could be done to address this:
* cache the blame every 10 revisions, so that when calculating the blame there's an upper limit of ancestor files you need to calculate the blame for
* Re-write the applyHunksToSpans in AuthorLinecountCalculator to be N rather than -N^2- N^3
* Consolidate the blame chunks either constantly or periodically
fields.summary: FE - address performance issues in author blame loc slurp

fields.description: Does our performance suck fullstop, or fail to scale? people page can use sanity 1. review test data: 1,10,100 file changset. activity stream test data, order of maginude like sanity 1, then x10, x100
fields.summary: Concurrent users: perf monitoring for people, review, activity stream inline with 1 user, 20 concurrent users

fields.description:
Searching takes several minutes to complete. 

Repository size:

{noformat}
.7G /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO/idx0
651M /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO/idx1
647M /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO/idx2
5.1G /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO/revcache
384M /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO/idx3
13G /home/jira/fecru-2.0.2/var/cache/REPO
{noformat}

{quote}
We are writing the cache to local disk. It's hardware raid 10, with a 512MB battery backed cache (perc 6 hardware). It's built of 8*15k RPM disks. Sustained write speed is around 300MB/s. Seek time is very low.
{quote}

However 

{quote}
I moved Fisheye over onto it's own SSD disk. It was a lot slower when we did that. So I don't think it being run on a raid 10 drive is the issue here. 
{quote}

Logs show:

fields.summary: Search takes a number of minutes to run

fields.description: We are just talking about initial slurp here.  The story comes from evaluators missing the yellow banner and getting confused by the difference between reality and FE.  We need to include the revision number cause this help support.  First pass should be a more prominant indication (movement on the screen) that slurping is happening (including revision we are at), no more granular indication of progress.  Remember clearcase support.

fields.description:
Using Jira Fisheye plugin version 2.5 against Fisheye/Crucible 2.0.3.  Currently, a link is displayed on the fisheye issue tab panel to "Create crucible review for all xxx changesets in yyyyy"  (where yyyyy is the name of the repository).    

When the number of related commits exceeds the "max changesets per project" setting, links for the additional changesets will appear at the bottom of the tab, identified by "More related changesets:"  In the link to create a crucible review, however, the number displayed in "xxx changesets" never exceeds the max changesets per project.  As a result, it's impossible to create a code review that contains all of the related changesets.  One can only create a code review containing the first xxx changesets (where xxx is the max).

Attached screenshot shows a situation where max is set to 5 and there are actually 13 changesets related to the issue.   Here, the user cannot create a code review with all 13 changesets.
fields.summary: Creating review from Jira Fisheye plugin's fisheye issue tab panel - need to be able to include all related changesets (beyond max changesets)
Integrate spike with slurper
Create upgrade task to delete and rebuild QuickNav indexes
Integrate spike with QuickNav UI

fields.description: Confluence already has tools to convert MS Word .doc files into text.  If they could be integrated into Crucible, it would become useful to a lot of people here who currently have no use for it.

fields.description:
When reviewing a code merge, the ability to do a three way diff can be essential.

There doesn't seem to be an easy way to do this from inside a crucible review?

fields.description:
no brainer to add the relevant meta tag for ie6 & ie7 user-agents

- dismissable banner for ie6 and ie7 (like the firebug warning).
- add the metatag to all pages.

we should also put a dismissible banner in pages for ie6 & ie7 users to prompt them to install Google chrome-frame.
fields.summary: Support google chrome-frame

fields.description:
When Crucible does a diff of two CVS files, it doesn't seem to refresh the $$ tags.

So for eg, comparing revisions 1.20.2.6 and 1.20.2.7 will show the following diff:
\-       * $Revision: 1.20.2.5 $
\+	 * $Revision: 1.20.2.6 $

Presumably because that's what was checked in.  CVS doesn't expand the $$ tags until the next checkout.

So I guess it makes some sense when you drill into it, but it isn't instantly intuitive that this is the best behaviour.

Would it be possible to add an option to expand/not expand the $$ tags?
fields.summary: option to refresh CVS tags

fields.summary: "Open in Crucible" link always leads to EAC/CRU

fields.description:
*Steps*
1. Make sure JIRA integration is setup
2. Create a new review
3. Enter {{CR-}} followed by any random number, e.g., {{CR-34343}}, into the linked issue in the _Review Details_ dialog
4. Click the 'link' button.

*Expected*
Error dialog because the JIRA doesn't exist.

*Actual*
The linking appears to work, i.e., the input field is replaced with a {{<a>}} to the non-existent JIRA.
fields.summary: Can link review to JIRAs that don't exist but with 'CR-' prefix

fields.description:
Favourited paths appear in the favourites menu with truncation after the first _n_ characters, meaning that paths that share a common prefix all have the same text.

We should perhaps truncate all prefix directories and leave the last portion of the path intact.

fields.description:
There are two cases here:
1. can add the author and moderator as reviewers
2. can change the author/mod to one of the reviewers

in both cases, the change appears to work in the dialog, but clicking 'done' and viewing the review details dialog again shows a sane state.

In the 2.0 branch, case 1 gives you an alert warning and case 2 unticks the checkbox next to the reviewers name.
fields.summary: Can add the author/mod as a reviewer and vice versa

fields.description:
*Steps*
1. Have two projects: A (with no default reviewers) and B (with default reviewers)
2. Create a blank review in project A
3. In the _Edit Details_ dialog, change the project to B

*Expected*
The default reviewers for project B should be added -- possibly the moderator, too (though might be annoying if you specifically selected someone else you had in mind and it reverts it)

*Actual*
The default reviewers/mod from project B are not added (in some manner) to the review.

Starting the review after doing this means that the default reviews/mod for project B are not part of the review.
fields.summary: Can bypass default reviewers/moderator by changing project in draft
Edit Review dialog shown twice for draft review after changing project

fields.description:
Hitting "y" once you've past the first-10-frxes-loaded results in an initial mark-as-read-of-newlyfocused-frx, and *then* the FRX gets loaded, which is displayed as UNREAD becauyse it was UNREAD when the server was generating the html
2:57
the auto-mark-as-read-on-focus should only trigger after the frx lazy load
fields.summary: Going to next-unread File marks it as read, but if it had to ajax-load it then it is loaded in unread-form

fields.description:
When a general email notification is sent it will have something like

{noformat}TST-2 A.D. Ministrator says:-



---

ID: TST-2 http://erdinger.sydney.atlassian.com/fisheye/cru/TST-2

Title: Test Me

Statement of Objectives:
1 2 3 

State: Review

Author: Test User
Moderator: Test User
Reviewers: (1 active, 0 completed*)
    A.D. Ministrator{noformat}

Rather than having the user "says" nothing, we should just print who made what change.
fields.summary: General Notification template contains empty comment when joining review etc

Firefox works.
